definition: to hide dirt, to conceal corruption (idiom); to shelter evil people and accept wrongdoing/aiding and abetting wicked deeds
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing

sentences.english: This company has been stopped for an audit because of its messy management and tolerance of misconduct.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司管理混乱藏污纳垢，已经停业查办了。
那家旅馆是个藏污纳垢之所。

sentences.english: He thinks of new york as a den of iniquity.
sentences.chinese: 他认为纽约是个藏污纳垢之处。

sentences.english: We think the place is a den of iniquity.
sentences.chinese: 他认为纽约是个藏污纳垢之处。

sentences.english: Is really man's vehicle "shelters evil people and countenances evil practices" the place?.
sentences.chinese: 难道男人的车真是“藏污纳垢”的地方？。

definition: to hide dirt, to conceal corruption (idiom); to shelter evil people and accept wrongdoing/aiding and abetting wicked deeds
to breed/to flourish/to cause/to provoke/to create
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
insect that eats into wood, books, clothes etc/fig. vermin
to pollute (often fig.)/to be infected by/to gain a small advantage
